snippet: There is nothing more personal for a baseball player than the varied ways in which they break in a glove so that it is just right for their hand and their position.
abstract: Most Major League Baseball players use unconventional methods to break in and maintain their gloves; some processes may last a matter of days, while others can take an entire year before glove is ready for use; method used by New York Yankees third baseman Alex Rodriguez involves placing his glove in freezer after each game.
lead_paragraph: There is nothing more personal for a baseball player than the varied ways in which they break in a glove so that it is just right for their hand and their position.

headline.main: To Break In Their Gloves, Yankees Dunk, Tenderize and Lather Up
headline.print_headline: Impressive Glove Work Before Yanks Take Field
